context: The Finnish verb 'päättää' has multiple related meanings. It can mean 'to make a decision or choice,' as in deciding what to do. It can also mean 'to bring something to an end or conclusion,' like finishing a meeting or discussion. The form changes depending on the subject and tense - for example, 'päätän' (I decide), 'päätti' (he/she decided), 'päättivät' (they decided).
